pullRequest.title: Delay init of ramclass link params
pullRequest.bodyText:
Delay init of ramclass link params
When a class fails loading due to a classloading constraint error, the
ramclass remains in the class memory segments with an unverified state.
This causes a a crash in the GC because the GC expects all ramclasses to
have classObjects assign. Delaying the linking of the class in the
memory segment list and subclass traversal list until after the class
passes loading constraints checks will ensure that the GC or any other
component cannot iterate an invalid class.
Fixes: #10541
Signed-off-by: Tobi Ajila atobia@ca.ibm.com

beforeCommit.message:
Assign object to ramclass in linkage error path

When a class fails loading due to a classloading constraint error, the
ramclass remains in the class memory segments with an unverified state.
This causes a a crash in the GC because the GC expects all ramclasses to
have classObjects assign. Removing the invalid ramclass from the class
memory segments and the loading constrains table will be very expensive.
This PR assigns the already allocated classObject to the invalid
ramClass. The invalid class cannot be instantiated since it is in a
permanent unverified state.

Fixes: https://github.com/eclipse/openj9/issues/10541

Signed-off-by: Tobi Ajila <atobia@ca.ibm.com>

afterCommit.message:
Assign object to ramclass in linkage error path

When a class fails loading due to a classloading constraint error, the
ramclass remains in the class memory segments with an unverified state.
This causes a a crash in the GC because the GC expects all ramclasses to
have classObjects assign. DElaying the linking of the class in the
memory segment list until after the class passes loading constraints
checks will ensure that the GC cannot iterate an invalid class.

Fixes: https://github.com/eclipse/openj9/issues/10541

Signed-off-by: Tobi Ajila <atobia@ca.ibm.com>

nodes.bodyText: I would move this comment (merge it with the one above) since this is in the not NULL path.

With this change, is the code above that handles the "already loaded" case still valid / required?  I think it can be removed now as there's no reason to link the abandoned class into anything as it won't be part of the list until this point
https://github.com/eclipse/openj9/blob/384c85680c1015e456521b6ab159ad00accf8684/runtime/vm/createramclass.cpp#L1974-L1980

beforeCommit.message:
Assign object to ramclass in linkage error path

When a class fails loading due to a classloading constraint error, the
ramclass remains in the class memory segments with an unverified state.
This causes a a crash in the GC because the GC expects all ramclasses to
have classObjects assign. Delaying the linking of the class in the
memory segment list until after the class passes loading constraints
checks will ensure that the GC cannot iterate an invalid class.

Fixes: https://github.com/eclipse/openj9/issues/10541

Signed-off-by: Tobi Ajila <atobia@ca.ibm.com>

beforeCommit.message:

ramclass remains in the class memory segments with an unverified state.

afterCommit.message:
Delay init of ramclass link params

When a class fails loading due to a classloading constraint error, the
ramclass remains in the class memory segments with an unverified state.
This causes a a crash in the GC because the GC expects all ramclasses to
have classObjects assign. Delaying the linking of the class in the
memory segment list and subclass traversal list until after the class
passes loading constraints
checks will ensure that the GC or any other component cannot iterate an
invalid class.

Fixes: https://github.com/eclipse/openj9/issues/10541

Signed-off-by: Tobi Ajila <atobia@ca.ibm.com>

beforeCommit.message:

ramclass remains in the class memory segments with an unverified state.
This causes a a crash in the GC because the GC expects all ramclasses to
have classObjects assign. Delaying the linking of the class in the
memory segment list and subclass traversal list until after the class
passes loading constraints
checks will ensure that the GC or any other component cannot iterate an
invalid class.

Fixes: https://github.com/eclipse/openj9/issues/10541

Signed-off-by: Tobi Ajila <atobia@ca.ibm.com>

afterCommit.message:
Delay init of ramclass link params

When a class fails loading due to a classloading constraint error, the
ramclass remains in the class memory segments with an unverified state.
This causes a a crash in the GC because the GC expects all ramclasses to

invalid class.

Delay init of ramclass link params

When a class fails loading due to a classloading constraint error, the
ramclass remains in the class memory segments with an unverified state.
This causes a a crash in the GC because the GC expects all ramclasses to
have classObjects assign. Delaying the linking of the class in the
memory segment list and subclass traversal list until after the class
passes loading constraints

invalid class.

nodes.bodyText:
Can you add a comment like:

Caller must hold the classTableMutex.

commit.message:
Delay init of ramclass link params

When a class fails loading due to a classloading constraint error, the
ramclass remains in the class memory segments with an unverified state.
This causes a a crash in the GC because the GC expects all ramclasses to
have classObjects assign. Delaying the linking of the class in the
memory segment list and subclass traversal list until after the class
passes loading constraints
checks will ensure that the GC or any other component cannot iterate an
invalid class.

Fixes: https://github.com/eclipse/openj9/issues/10541

Signed-off-by: Tobi Ajila <atobia@ca.ibm.com>

beforeCommit.message:
Delay init of ramclass link params

When a class fails loading due to a classloading constraint error, the
ramclass remains in the class memory segments with an unverified state.
This causes a a crash in the GC because the GC expects all ramclasses to
have classObjects assign. Delaying the linking of the class in the
memory segment list and subclass traversal list until after the class
passes loading constraints
checks will ensure that the GC or any other component cannot iterate an
invalid class.

Fixes: https://github.com/eclipse/openj9/issues/10541

Signed-off-by: Tobi Ajila <atobia@ca.ibm.com>

When a class fails loading due to a classloading constraint error, the
ramclass remains in the class memory segments with an unverified state.
This causes a a crash in the GC because the GC expects all ramclasses to
have classObjects assign. Delaying the linking of the class in the
memory segment list and subclass traversal list until after the class
passes loading constraints
checks will ensure that the GC or any other component cannot iterate an
invalid class.

Fixes: https://github.com/eclipse/openj9/issues/10541

Signed-off-by: Tobi Ajila <atobia@ca.ibm.com>
